document.docOrigin: Journal of Natural History (J. Nat. Hist.) 47 (13 - 14)
document.docTitle: Dicerapanorpa magna Zhong & Hua 2013, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Dicerapanorpa, a new genus of East Asian Panorpidae (Insecta: Mecoptera: Penorpidae) with descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Dicerapanorpa, a new genus of East Asian Panorpidae (Insecta: Mecoptera: Penorpidae) with descriptions of two new species

), Ningshan Co. , June–July 2011, leg. QX Chen and W Zhong.

This species differs from its congeners by the marginal spot extending to vein R 2+3 ; parameres of male with an undeveloped basal branch; subgenital plate of female ovoid, widest at middle; genital plate broad, posterior arms short and curved mesally.

Wings . Forewing length 15.5–17.0 mm, width 4.3–4.6 mm ; hindwing length 13.0–15.0 mm, width 4.0– 4.2 mm . Wings light yellow, with dark brown markings; apical band broad, often enclosing a large hyaline window spot, which is sometimes divided into small spots; pterostigmal band complete, with a broad basal and a narrow distal branch; marginal spot extending to vein R 2+3 or reduced to a spot between veins R 1 and R 2+3 ; basal band complete, extending from Sc to 1A; basal spot very small. Hindwing similar to forewing, except for the marginal spot and basal band usually reduced and basal spot mostly absent ( Figure 1C ).

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1.
Dicerapanorpa magna
, from Huoditang, Ningshan, Shaanxi. (A) Male; (B) female; (C) male, dorsal view; (D) female, dorsal view; (E) head of male, frontal view; (F) notal organ of male, lateral view; (G) male abdomen, lateral view. Scale bars: C and D = 3.0 mm; E = 0.5 mm; F = 0.3 mm; G = 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Venation . In forewings, vein Sc extending into pterostigma; R 2 usually bifurcate; R 4+5 almost half the length of R 2+3 ; M 1 usually simple. Hindwings similar to forewings, but Sc shorter; R 1 usually bifurcate distally; M coalescing basally with CuA for a short distance ( Figure 1C ).

caption.paragraph:
Figure 2.
Dicerapanorpa magna
, male genitalia, from Huoditang, Ningshan, Shaanxi. (A), (B) Genital bulb, dorsal and ventral views; (C) genital bulb, ventral view with hypovalves removed; (D, E) aedeagus complex, ventral and caudal views. gcx, gonocoxite; gs, gonostylus; hv, hypovalv; pm, paramere; vv, ventral valve of aedeagus; dv, dorsal valve of aedeagus. Scale bars: A–C = 0.5 mm; D and E = 200 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head, thorax and abdomen similar to those of male in colour and patterns. Forewing length 16.5–18.0 mm, width 5.0– 5.5 mm ; hindwing length 15.5–16.0 mm, width 4.5–5.2 mm . Markings similar to male; the basal band in forewing wider than male; basal band of hindwing complete, extending from R 1 to CuA ( Figure 1B, D ).

Female genitalia . Subgenital plate ovoid, terminating in a ligulate process, with long setae on the distal third, especially the lateral and caudal margins ( Figure 3 A–C). Genital plate broad, slightly narrow at base, ventrally folded on each side. Axis very short, almost entirely concealed in the main plate, only protruding as a small triangular process from caudal margin between the broad posterior arms ( Figure 3 D–F).

Numerous adults of
D . magna
were collected from late May to mid August at the edges of coniferous and broad-leaf mixed forest, with dense sub-shrubs. At the type locality, the general habitat is mixed hardwoods, primarily
Betula albosinensis
and
Pinus
sp. mainly with
Anemone hupehensis
and
Artemisia
sp. as herbaceous groundcover. Adults are often found in moist microenvironment and hid on plant stems in the dense shade to avoid sunshine.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 3.
Dicerapanorpa magna
, female abdomen and genitalia, from Huoditang, Ningshan, Shaanxi. (A) Abdominal segments IX–XI, lateral view; (B) same, ventral view; (C) subgenital plate, ventral view; (D–F) genital plate, ventral, lateral, and dorsal views. Scale bars: A–C = 0.3 mm; D–F = 0.2 mm.
